segments.en: “Mendicants, isn’t poverty suffering in the world for a person who enjoys sensual pleasures?”

segments.pli: “Yampi, bhikkhave, daliddo assako anāḷhiko iṇaṃ ādiyati, iṇādānampi, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ lokasmiṃ kāmabhogino”ti?
segments.en: “When a poor, penniless person falls into debt, isn’t being in debt also suffering in the world for a person who enjoys sensual pleasures?”

segments.pli: “Yampi, bhikkhave, daliddo assako anāḷhiko iṇaṃ ādiyitvā vaḍḍhiṃ paṭissuṇāti, vaḍḍhipi, bhikkhave, dukkhā lokasmiṃ kāmabhogino”ti?
segments.en: “When a poor person who has fallen into debt agrees to pay interest, isn’t the interest also suffering in the world for a person who enjoys sensual pleasures?”

segments.pli: “Yampi, bhikkhave, daliddo assako anāḷhiko vaḍḍhiṃ paṭissuṇitvā kālābhataṃ vaḍḍhiṃ na deti, codentipi naṃ;
segments.en: “When a poor person who has fallen into debt and agreed to pay interest fails to pay it when it falls due, they get a warning.
Isn’t being warned suffering in the world for a person who enjoys sensual pleasures?”

segments.pli: “Yampi, bhikkhave, daliddo assako anāḷhiko codiyamāno na deti, anucarantipi naṃ;
segments.en: “When a poor person fails to pay after getting a warning, they’re prosecuted.
Isn’t being prosecuted suffering in the world for a person who enjoys sensual pleasures?”

segments.pli: “Yampi, bhikkhave, daliddo assako anāḷhiko anucariyamāno na deti, bandhantipi naṃ;
segments.en: “When a poor person fails to pay after being prosecuted, they’re imprisoned.
Isn’t being imprisoned suffering in the world for a person who enjoys sensual pleasures?”

segments.pli: “Iti kho, bhikkhave, dāliddiyampi dukkhaṃ lokasmiṃ kāmabhogino, iṇādānampi dukkhaṃ lokasmiṃ kāmabhogino, vaḍḍhipi dukkhā lokasmiṃ kāmabhogino, codanāpi dukkhā lokasmiṃ kāmabhogino, anucariyāpi dukkhā lokasmiṃ kāmabhogino, bandhanampi dukkhaṃ lokasmiṃ kāmabhogino;
segments.en: “So mendicants, poverty, debt, interest, warnings, prosecution, and imprisonment are suffering in the world for those who enjoy sensual pleasures.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci saddhā natthi kusalesu dhammesu, hirī natthi kusalesu dhammesu, ottappaṃ natthi kusalesu dhammesu, vīriyaṃ natthi kusalesu dhammesu, paññā natthi kusalesu dhammesu—
segments.en: In the same way, whoever has no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities

segments.pli: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye daliddo assako anāḷhiko.
segments.en: is called poor and penniless in the training of the noble one.

segments.pli: Sa kho so, bhikkhave, daliddo assako anāḷhiko saddhāya asati kusalesu dhammesu, hiriyā asati kusalesu dhammesu, ottappe asati kusalesu dhammesu, vīriye asati kusalesu dhammesu, paññāya asati kusalesu dhammesu, kāyena duccaritaṃ carati, vācāya duccaritaṃ carati, manasā duccaritaṃ carati.
segments.en: Since they have no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, or wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities, they do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
This is how they’re in debt, I say.

segments.pli: So tassa kāyaduccaritassa paṭicchādanahetu pāpikaṃ icchaṃ paṇidahati.
segments.en: In order to conceal the bad things they do by way of body, speech, and mind they harbour corrupt wishes.

segments.pli: ‘Mā maṃ jaññū’ti icchati, ‘mā maṃ jaññū’ti saṅkappati, ‘mā maṃ jaññū’ti vācaṃ bhāsati, ‘mā maṃ jaññū’ti kāyena parakkamati. So tassa vacīduccaritassa paṭicchādanahetu … pe … so tassa manoduccaritassa paṭicchādanahetu … pe … ‘mā maṃ jaññū’ti kāyena parakkamati.
segments.en: They wish, plan, speak, and act with the thought: ‘May no-one find me out!’
This is how they pay interest, I say.
Good-hearted spiritual companions say this about them:
‘This venerable acts like this, and behaves like that.’
This is how they’re warned, I say.

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ araññagataṃ vā rukkhamūlagataṃ vā suññāgāragataṃ vā vippaṭisārasahagatā pāpakā akusalavitakkā samudācaranti.
segments.en: When they go to a wilderness, the root of a tree, or an empty hut, they’re beset by remorseful, unskillful thoughts.
This is how they’re prosecuted, I say.

segments.pli: Sa kho so, bhikkhave, daliddo assako anāḷhiko kāyena duccaritaṃ caritvā vācāya duccaritaṃ caritvā manasā duccaritaṃ caritvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā nirayabandhane vā bajjhati tiracchānayonibandhane vā.
segments.en: That poor, penniless person has done bad things by way of body, speech, and mind. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re trapped in the prison of hell or the animal realm.

segments.pli: Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekabandhanampi samanupassāmi evaṃdāruṇaṃ evaṃkaṭukaṃ evaṃantarāyakaraṃ anuttarassa yogakkhemassa adhigamāya, yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, nirayabandhanaṃ vā tiracchānayonibandhanaṃ vāti.
segments.en: I don’t see a single prison that’s as brutal, as vicious, and such an obstacle to reaching the supreme sanctuary as the prison of hell or the animal realm.
Poverty is said to be suffering in the world,
and so is being in debt.
A poor person who has fallen in debt
worries even when spending the loan.
for someone who prays for pleasure and possessions.
In the same way, in the noble one’s training
they wish, ‘May no-one find me out!’
on and on, life after life.
is a poor person who has fallen in debt,
and worries even when spending the loan.
And when in village or wilderness
goes to one of the animal realms,
from which a wise one is released.
with wealth that is properly earned.
welfare and benefit in this life,
This is how, for a householder,
In the same way, in the noble one’s training,
They give up the five hindrances,
by not grasping in any way,
To that poised one, rightly freed
with the end of the fetters of rebirth,
this is the highest freedom from debt.”

suttaplex.blurb: Poor people suffer when they get in debt. Spiritual practitioners who are devoid of good qualities suffer in a similar way.
